alert.note: Alert for Pulaski; Rockcastle; Wayne (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued February 16 at 3:52PM EST by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northern Wayne, Pulaski and western Rockcastle Counties through 430 PM EST... At 352 PM EST, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Danville to near Jamestown. Movement was northeast at 50 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Faubush, Cains Store, Naomi, Pointer, Nancy, Pulaski County Park, Magnum, Hogue, Stab, Somerset, Science Hill, Dabney, Bobtown, Somerset Pulaski Airport, Elihu and Ruth. THIS INCLUDES THE FOLLOWING HIGHWAYS... Interstate 75 in east central Kentucky between mile markers 60 and 72. Kentucky Highway 80 in Pulaski County between mile markers 17 and 31. Louis B. Nunn Parkway MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
